title: Walnut Vinaigrette Dressing
description: Combine a handful of walnuts and raisins with a splash of balsamic vinegar and some seasonings to create a wonderful dressing that compliments any type of salad.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a high-powered blender.
author: www.drfuhrman.com

title: Quick and Easy Kale and White Bean Stew
description: Who doesn't like quick and easy? This tasty stew comes together quickly and makes enough for leftovers the next day!
instructions:
Place kale and water in a soup pot, cover and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes or until kale is almost tender, stirring occasionally. Add remaining ingredients, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally.

If desired, partially blend the soup using an immersion blender.

ingredientsList.ingredient: bunch kale,  tough stems removed and coarsely chopped (see note)
Dr. Fuhrman's MatoZest or other no-salt seasoning blend, adjusted to taste
crushed red pepper or to taste
cooked or 2 (15 ounce) cans low sodium or no-salt-added cannellini or other white beans
diced tomatoes, fresh or packaged in non-BPA packaging
low sodium or no-salt-added vegetable broth or more as needed to achieve desired consistency

comment: Note: Frozen kale or other fresh or frozen greens may be substituted.
author: Marissa

title: Indian-Spiced Lentil and Hemp Sliders with Apricot Chutney
description: Ginger, coriander and cumin spice up these exotic mini burgers. Apricot chutney served on the side, provides a sweet and spicy note.
instructions:
To make the patties, heat 2-3 tablespoons water in a large saute pan and saute onions, carrots, red pepper, garlic and ginger for 7-10 minutes adding additional water if needed to prevent burning. Add coriander, cumin and turmeric and saute for 10 seconds. Remove from heat and mix in cooked lentils, hemp seed, flax seed, chili paste, corn starch, kale and orange zest. Form into patties and bake at 350 degrees F for 10 minutes on each side.

To make the chutney, water saute the onions and celery for 5 minutes. Add the cinnamon, chili powder and allspice and saute for 10 seconds.
Add remaining ingredients, bring to a boil and simmer for 20 minutes.

Serve each patty on a piece of butter lettuce, with sliced tomato and onion and a spoonful of Apricot Chutney.

ingredientsList.ingredient: FOR THE LENTIL PATTIES: diced onion
chili paste, such as Sambal Oelek
FOR THE APRICOT CHUTNEY: finely diced onions
TO FINISH THE DISH: head butter leaf lettuce

author: Martin Oswald

title: Instant Pot Tofu Makhani (Vegan Butter Chicken)
description: Makhani sauce is a rich creamy gravy made with tomatoes, onions and Indian spices.
instructions:
In a high-powered blender, blend the cashews, date and 1/4 cup of the vegetable broth until smooth and creamy. Set aside to be added after the pressure cooker cycle is completed.

Blend the onions, garlic, ginger, paprika and remaining 3/4 cup of the vegetable broth.

Place the tofu cubes in a bowl and toss with about 1/2 cup of the onion puree mixture. Let sit for 10 minutes.

Combine the tofu cubes, remaining onion puree, tomato puree, coriander powder and cayenne in an Instant Pot. Follow the manufacturer's guide for locking the lid and preparing to cook. Pressure cook on high for 10 minutes.

After the pressure cook cycle is complete, follow the manufacturer's guide for quick release and wait until the quick release cycle is complete. Unlock and remove lid. Stir in garma masala, cashew cream, lemon juice and spinach. Replace lid and let sit for 5 minutes to allow spinach to wilt.

Serve on top of cauliflower rice or intact whole grain such as quinoa.

To make on the stove top, Use a sauce pan to simmer the tofu cubes in the onion puree mixture for five minutes. Add the tomato puree and cook for two minutes. Add the coriander and cayenne pepper and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in garam masala, lemon juice, cashew cream and spinach and simmer until the spinach is wilted. Add additional vegetable broth if needed to adjust consistency.

ingredientsList.ingredient: regular date or 1/2 medjool date, pitted
no-salt-added or low sodium vegetable broth, divided
extra firm tofu, excess water pressed out, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
cooked cauliflower rice, quinoa or other whole grain

author: www.drfuhrman.com

title: Quick Spinach and Chickpea Curry
description: Greens and beans get an Indian-inspired flavor boost from a combination of curry, turmeric and hot pepper flakes. This easy meal comes together in minutes!
instructions:
In a non-stick skillet over medium heat, sauté the onion, stirring constantly, until it is almost tender. Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute. Add a tablespoon of water if needed to prevent sticking.

Add the garbanzo beans, tomatoes, spinach, red pepper flakes, curry and turmeric. Stir and cook until spinach is wilted. Cover and cook over low heat for an additional 10 minutes to allow flavors to blend.

Serve over quinoa or other whole grain or riced cauliflower.

ingredientsList.ingredient: cooked or 1 (15 ounce) can no-salt-added or low sodium garbanzo beans, drained
diced tomatoes or 1 (15 ounce) can diced tomatoes
baby spinach or 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen chopped spinach, thawed
red pepper flakes, or to taste
cooked quinoa, farro or other intact whole grain or cooked riced cauliflower

author: www.DrFuhrman.com

title: Tikka Masala
description: Dinner tonight: Lots of veggies in a creamy, flavor-packed sauce! Try this good-for-you version of a popular Indian take-out dish.
instructions:
In a soup pot, toast cumin seeds over medium low heat until they become aromatic, then immediately add water to stop browning. Add the onion, garlic and ginger and saute until the vegetables are translucent and the mixture is almost dry, roughly 10 minutes on medium heat.

Stir in garam masala, turmeric and paprika. Add tomato paste and continue to cook and stir until the mixture is reduced and pasty.

Add coconut milk, crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth and bring to a simmer. Add chickpeas and red bell peppers. Simmer until peppers are 75% soft. Add broccoli and simmer for another 15 minutes or until broccoli is tender and the mixture is thickened and easily coats the back of a spoon. If at any point, the mixture thickens too much, add a bit of broth or water to thin it out.

Before serving, stir in lemon juice and cilantro. If desired, serve over quinoa or other intact whole grain.

ingredientsList.ingredient: no-salt-added or low sodium vegetable broth
cooked or low sodium/no-salt-added canned chickpeas
broccoli florets and stalks, blanched until just tender

author: Victor Boroda

title: Southern Tofu Scramble
description: Get a south-of-the-border vibe going with this easy tofu scramble. It's great for breakfast (or lunch or dinner)!
instructions:
Mix cubed tofu with turmeric and black pepper.

Place tofu and mushrooms in a sauté pan. Sprinkle with garlic powder and onion powder and cook for 5 minutes. Add beans and continue cooking until beans are warm.

Transfer mixture to a bowl. Top with salsa verde, lettuce, tomato, and guacamole.

ingredientsList.ingredient: 3.5 ounces soft tofu, drained and cubed

author: Jenna Fuhrman

title: Black-eyed Collards
description: Cook up collard greens and black-eyed peas for some down-home Southern flavor.
instructions:
Heat 2-3 tablespoons of the vegetable broth in a large skillet, add onion slices and saute until tender. Add collards, remaining vegetable broth and currants, bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and cook for 5 minutes or until collards are tender.
Stir in black eyed peas and hot pepper flakes and heat through.

Note: Any white bean may be substituted for black-eyed peas.

ingredientsList.ingredient: low sodium or no-salt-added vegetable broth
cooked black eyed peas or 1 (15 ounce) can low sodium or no-salt-added black eyed peas
hot pepper flakes, or more to taste

author: www.DrFuhrman.com

title: Classic Apple Pie
description: Enjoy a guilt-free slice of this all-American classic. Make a tender crust from nut butter and oat flour and fill it with a luscious mixture of apples, dates and spices.
instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.

To make the crust:
Place oat flour and nut butter in a bowl and mash with a fork until crumbly. Add water one tablespoon at a time and blend in with the fork until dough is moist enough to roll out. Roll 1/2 of the dough out between two pieces of wax paper and place in a pie plate. Bake for 10 minutes before filling.

Roll out remaining dough to be used for top crust.

To make the filling:
Slice 6 of the apples, place in a bowl and toss with 2 tablespoons of the lemon juice.

Combine cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice.

Place the remaining 2 apples, 1 tablespoon of the lemon juice, dates and 1 teaspoon of the spice mixture in a high-powered blender and blend until smooth. Fold into the sliced apples. Sprinkle with remaining spice mixture.

Place filling in the prebaked bottom crust. Put top crust on top, brush with non-dairy milk and bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven, brush again, and bake for an additional 15-20 minutes, until lightly browned.

Sprinkle with additional cinnamon.

Note: You can purchase oat flour at most large supermarkets or health food stores or make it yourself by processing old-fashioned oats in a food processor until finely ground.

ingredientsList.ingredient: FOR THE PIE CRUST:  oat flour (see note)
FOR THE FILLING: Winesap apples, peeled and cored, divided

author: Deana Ferreri

title: Mac and "Cheese"
description: Combine a creamy vegan cheese sauce with bean pasta and mushrooms. It's delicious and guilt-free!
instructions:
To make the "cheese" sauce, place chopped sweet potatoes, carrots and onions on a lightly-oiled baking sheet and roast at 375 degrees F for 20 minutes or until tender. (You can also boil in a small pot for 15 minutes or until tender and use the cooking water as your 3/4 cup water for blending).

When vegetables are soft, place them in a blender along remaining sauce ingredients and blend until smooth.

Cook pasta according to package ingredients. Heat 1-2 tablespoons water in a pan and saute mushrooms.

Combine pasta, mushrooms and "cheese" sauce.

ingredientsList.ingredient: FOR THE CHEESE SAUCE: peeled nd diced Japanese or regular sweet potatoes
raw cashews, soaked for 2 hours, then drained

author: Cara Furhman

title: Healthy Caesar Dressing
description: This favorite gets an extra flavor kick from freshly roasted garlic.
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Roast garlic for about 25 minutes or until soft.

When cool, remove the skins and blend with the remaining ingredients in a food processor or high-powered blender until creamy and smooth. 

May be used for a veggie dip or salad dressing.

ingredientsList.ingredient: unsweetened soy, almond or hemp milk

author: Casinera

title: Walnut Vinaigrette Dressing
description: Combine a handful of walnuts and raisins with a splash of balsamic vinegar and some seasonings to create a wonderful dressing that compliments any type of salad.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a high-powered blender.
author: www.drfuhrman.com

title: Greek Lentil Soup
description: Greek Lentil Soup or Fakes Soupa, is a staple in Greek kitchens. It is traditionally finished with a splash of vinegar.
instructions:
Place onions, carrots, garlic, lentils, broth, oregano, rosemary and bay leaves in a large soup pot. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.

Stir in tomato paste and tomatoes. Cover and simmer until the lentils have softened, 30 to 40 minutes. Add water if needed to adjust consistency.

Add kale and heat until wilted. Serve with a drizzle of vinegar.

ingredientsList.ingredient: no-sal added or low-sodium vegetable broth
finely chopped kale or other greens
Dr. Fuhrman's Black Fig Vinegar or red wine vinegar

author: www.DrFuhrman.com

title: Popeye Pitas with Mediterranean Tomato Spread
description: Prepare a tray of these hearty stuffed pitas for easy stress-free entertaining. They also work well for brown bag lunches.
instructions: Combine spread ingredients in a high-powdered blender or food processor until smooth.Toast pitas, slice open a top slit, and spread apart. Stuff with sandwich ingredients and spread.

ingredientsList.ingredient: cooked or canned  great northern beans, low sodium or no-salt-added, drained

comment: NOTE: Use Mediterranean pine nuts if available. Chopped almonds may be substituted. See box.
author: DrFuhrman.com

title: Tofu Spinach Meatballs
description: Time for an Italian comfort food classic? Try these flavorful baked meatballs in tomato sauce.
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS:
Place spinach (or kale or collards) in a large bowl and separate it with your fingers. Crumble the tofu into the bowl. Add the nutritional yeast, nuts, 4 tablespoons of the flour and the seasonings. Combine ground flax seeds with water to form a paste. Add to the spinach-tofu mixture and mix together to form a dough. Add additional flour as needed if mixture seems too wet.

Using a tablespoon or small ice cream scoop, form mixture into compact, firm balls. Roll in bread crumbs.

Spoon some sauce into a baking dish, add the balls and cover with additional sauce and top with non-dairy mozzarella. Cover the baking dish and bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until heated through and the cheese is melted. Serve with additional sauce, if desired.

Can be served with bean pasta (available at www.drfuhrman.com).

This mixture would also work as a warm spinach dip for raw vegetables.

ingredientsList.ingredient: frozen chopped spinach, kale or collards, thawed and squeezed dry
(14 ounce) package extra-firm tofu, drained and pressed
chickpea, oat, or whole what flour
salt-free Mrs. Dash or to taste
low sodium or no-salt-added pasta sauce

author: David Grosch

title: Broccoli Quiche with Aquafaba
description: Don’t throw away the cooking liquid from your canned or home-cooked beans. You can use it to make a light and fluffy broccoli and mushroom quiche.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.  Heat 2-3 tablespoons of water in a large pan and add sliced onion and mushrooms. Water saute until onions are tender, adding small amounts of additional water as needed to prevent sticking. Add broccoli and a few more tablespoons of water, cover and cook for 5 minutes or until broccoli is almost tender.  Combine remaining ingredients in a high-powered blender and blend for at least one minute to whip up the aquafaba.  Place onions, mushrooms and broccoli in a cake pan that has been wiped with olive oil. Pour blended mixture on top and stir to combine.  Bake for 35-40 minutes or until top is golden brown. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before cutting.

ingredientsList.ingredient: unsweetened soy, hemp, or almond milk

comment: Note: Aquafaba is the cooking liquid from beans and other legumes like chickpeas. It is the typically discarded liquid found in retail cans and boxes of beans, or the liquid left over from cooking your own from dried.
author: Dr. Fuhrman

title: Chocolate Pecan Smoothie
description: This smoothie sounds decadent and tastes wonderful, but it is also packed with good-for-you, nutrient-dense ingredients.
instructions: Blend ingredients in a high-powered blender until smooth.

ingredientsList.ingredient: unsweetened soy, hemp or almond milk
unsweetened soy, hemp or almond milk

author: www.DrFuhrman.com

title: Cherry Berry Smoothie Bowl
description: Smoothie bowls are all about the toppings! Get creative and express yourself with seeds, nuts, fruit, coconut and/or cocoa nibs.
instructions: Blend all ingredients except toppings in a high-powered blender. Transfer to a bowl and add your choice of toppings

ingredientsList.ingredient: unsweetened soy, hemp or almond milk
Optional toppings: cocoa nibs, chopped raw nuts, seeds, unsweetened dried coconut, fruit

author: www.DrFuhrman.com

title: Bean Pasta and Vegetables with Thai Coconut Sauce
description: Bean pastas are a great alternative way to get your daily serving of beans. In this flavor-packed dish, bean pasta and Asian vegetables are combined with a sauce made with coconut, lemon grass and ginger.
instructions: Place coconut milk beverage, lemongrass, lime peel, and ginger in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, cover and let steep for 30 minutes. Mash lemongrass, lime peel, and ginger into mixture with a wooden spoon. Pour through a fine-mesh strainer to remove fibers. Add coconut milk to a high-powered blender along with shredded coconut, dates, lime juice, and cayenne pepper. Blend until smooth and creamy.In a large wok or skillet, heat water or white wine, add garlic, broccoli, carrots, and baby corn, and stir-fry for 2 minutes, adding more water as needed. Add mushrooms and bok choy and continue to cook until vegetables start to soften, about 4 minutes. Add coconut sauce, cover, and cook for 2 to 3 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.Meanwhile, cook spaghetti according to package directions.Serve pasta topped with vegetables and sauce. Sprinkle with lightly toasted nuts.

ingredientsList.ingredient: (4-inch) stalks lemongrass, broken up into small pieces
Peel of 1 organic lime, with pith removed
cayenne pepper, or more to taste
broccoli florets, cut into bite-size pieces
raw macadamia nuts, raw cashews, or raw Spanish peanuts, lightly toasted

author: James Rohrbacher

title: Thai Vegetable Curry
description: No description
instructions: Place the garlic, ginger, basil, cilantro, carrot juice, bell pepper, eggplant, green beans, mushrooms, bamboo shoots, crushed red pepper, curry powder, and 1 cup of the watercress in a wok or large skillet. Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until all the vegetables are tender. Mix in the peanut butter. Add the tofu, bring to a simmer, and toss until hot. Add the coconut milk and heat through. Top with the remaining 1 cup watercress. Garnish with basil or cilantro leaves, if desired. May be served over brown rice or quinoa.

ingredientsList.ingredient: red bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
large eggplant, peeled, if desired, and cut into 1-inch cubes
crushed red pepper flakes, or adjusted to taste
firm tofu, cut into ¼-inch-thick slices
Basil or cilantro leaves, for garnish

author: www.DrFuhrman.com

title: Thai Tofu and Veggies
description: Marinated, baked tofu and crisp-tender vegetables are combined with a Thai-inspired peanut sauce for a stir-fry dinner that is so much better than take-out.
instructions: To press excess liquid from tofu, wrap in 4 or 5 layers of paper towels and place on a plate. Cover with a second plate and balance a heavy can or two on top to weigh down the plate and press down the tofu; set aside to drain for 30 minutes. Remove and discard the paper towels, then replace with dry paper towels and repeat process a second time. Chop into 3/4Pierce each square with a fork.Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Make tofu marinade by combining orange juice, 1 tablespoon of the rice wine vinegar, coconut aminos, the tamarind paste, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder and 1/2 teaspoon of the chili powder. Add tofu to the marinade and toss. Bake the tofu on a non-stick pan or a Silpat until it starts to turn brown, about 30-40 minutes, flipping after 15 minutes. In a small saucepan, combine peanut butter, coconut milk, 1 tablespoon of rice wine vinegar, lime juice, and the remaining garlic powder and chili powder. Heat, stirring occasionally. Heat 2 tablespoons water in a large saute pan and water saute broccoli florets and onion until just tender, adding more water as needed. Stir in baked tofu, squash, carrots, snow peas, basil and peanut butter mixture and heat through. Top with chopped scallion, sliced basil, and chopped cashews. Sprinkle chili powder as desired. Garnish with a wedge of lime.

ingredientsList.ingredient: small yellow summer squash, cut into very thin ribbons
fresh basil, cut into thin strips plus extra for garnish
chopped raw cashews or 2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds

author: Kathleen Callahan

title: Easy Vegan Thai Greens and Beans Curry
description: This easy vegan Thai inspired recipe for greens and beans curry is one the whole family will love! Simmered with savory spices, peanut butter, kale, and white beans, you’ll have this flavorful simple supper on the table in 30 minutes or less.
instructions: Heat a large pan with two tablespoons oil (or 1/4 cup water if water sautéing). Add onion and ginger; cook until softened. Add chili powder and mix well. Whisk in broth, peanut butter tomato sauce, and salt free seasoning, then bring to a simmer, whisking occasionally to ensure the peanut butter is fully distributed. Add kale a handful at a time, stirring as you go. Add beans and stir to combine. Partially cover the pot and let it simmer for about 15 minutes, or until kale is tender, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Stir in lime juice and top with finely sliced green onions. Serve over rice or quinoa.

ingredientsList.ingredient: natural peanut butter (no sugar or any other additives)

comment: When I'm in a hurry, I use frozen chopped kale. The stems aren't removed, but it works in a pinch! You can serve over white rice, brown rice, or quinoa.
author: Bubbling Brook, Jaime

title: Thai Butternut Soup
description: This soup was pretty much my first best friend when starting Eat to Live. It feels indulgent, and it's SO SO good during the winter months. I am confident that you will all enjoy it as well. As always, if you desire salt, sprinkle it on your soup once it's in the bowl. I think you're gonna love this...
instructions: In a large stock pot, water sauté yellow onion, butternut squash, ginger, cilantro, and chopped garlic, turning often. Once onion is fragrant, stir in curry powder, stirring to ensure that all pieces are coated. Cover ingredients with 2 cups vegetable broth. Simmer over medium heat until squash is tender and can be mashed with a fork. Add remaining ingredients: coconut milk, lime juice, garbanzo beans, peanut butter, and red pepper to taste. In a microwave safe bowl, heat pitted dates in 1/4 cup water for one minute in the microwave. Add date/water mixture to the soup. Remove pot from heat and use an immersion blender to blend soup to desired consistency. I like to save a 1/2 cup of garbanzo beans to add after blending. Just a personal preference. It's great when it's smooth and creamy!

ingredientsList.ingredient: fresh ginger root grated or sliced fine

comment: As with most of the recipes on Eat to Live Daily, this does not include salt.  If you desire salt, add it to the surface of your soup once it's in your bowl.
author: Eat to Live Daily, Elisha, CNC

title: Thai Peanut Veggie Stirfry Recipe
description: Here is another fantastic recipe from the book Eat to Live — its a Nutritarian recipe called the Thai Peanut Veggie Stirfry Recipe and I am in love with it. It makes a LOT, so you can freeze leftovers for later.It contains a great variety of high-nutrient foods, including watercress (highest nutrient food on the planet!). It will introduce you to some great new ingredients if you’ve never used them before. It’s super easy to make stirfrys: and it’s all one pot!
instructions: In a large saute pan or wok over medium heat, add everything but the last 4 ingredients. Stir to combine thoroughly and cover. Cook for about 20 minutes or until the veggies are just tender, stirring occasionally, if necessary. Add the tofu, coconut milk and peanut butter and stir to combine. Serve immediately, topped with a small handful of fresh watercress and a sprinkle of 1 tablespoon chopped peanuts. :-)

ingredientsList.ingredient: can bamboo shoots, drained and chopped
watercress, roughly torn, plus a handful
cloves fresh garlic, grated or minced
block extra firm tofu, drained, pressed and cubed
natural, no salt added peanut butter

author: Dr. Joel Fuhrman

title: Chocolate Cherry Smoothie
description: A winning combination of cocoa and cherries makes this one of Dr. Fuhrman's top-rated smoothies. Pomegranate juice, spinach and lettuce make it a nutrient-dense treat.
instructions: Blend ingredients in a high-powered blender.

ingredientsList.ingredient: unsweetened soy, hemp or almond milk
pomegranate juice, cherry juice or cherry pomegranate juice
pure vanilla bean powder or alcohol-free vanilla extract

author: Dr. Joel Fuhrman

title: Easy Black Beet Burgers
description: You can't beat these Beet Burgers. Garnish them with baby lettuce, tomato, sliced red onion and maybe some avocado!
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Add 2 tablespoons of water to a pan along with onions and garlic. Water saute until onions are softened. Set aside 1/2 cup of the black beans. Add cooked onion mixture, remaining black beans, beets, walnuts, oats, chili powder, smoked paprika, ketchup and coconut aminos to a food processor and pulse until mostly smooth with some texture. Scrape the mixture into a bowl and fold in the reserved 1/2 cup of beans. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or Silpat. Form into 6 burgers. If desired, use an ice cream scoop and flatten mixture to make the burgers. Bake for 20 minutes, then flip burgers and bake for an additional 20 minutes.

ingredientsList.ingredient: cooked or 1 (15 ounce) can no-salt-added or low sodium black beans, drained
beets, cooked, peeled and roughly chopped
Dr. Fuhrman's Ketchup or other no-salt, no-sugar-added ketchup

author: Jenna Fuhrman

title: Summertime Gazpacho Recipe
description: A fantastic cold soup, gazpacho can be used as a salsa, salad dressing, or sauce as well!
instructions: To a food processor, add all ingredients except the vinegars and lime and process until desired chunkiness. (I prefer chunky! You can do this in separate batches of ingredients at a time, and mix together at the end. Add the vinegar and lime juice and stir to combine. Store extra in airtight freezer containers, and thaw the night before when ready to eat.

ingredientsList.ingredient: large red bell pepper, deseeded and chopped
large jalapeño, deseeded and chopped (add the seeds if you love heat!)

author: Cheri

title: Spicy Thai Braised Kale and Tofu
description: Thai peanut sauce made with peanut butter, lime juice, ginger, onion and a chili pepper gives a kick to this kale and baked tofu stir fry. Add an extra jalapeno pepper if you like it spicy.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place tofu cubes on a lightly-oiled baking dish and bake for 30 minutes, turning after 15 minutes.Heat a large saute pan and add onion, ginger, and jalapeno. Cook until onion has softened, adding 1-2 teaspoons of water as needed to prevent sticking. Add chili powder and cook one more minute. Whisk in vegetable broth, peanut butter, tomato paste, MatoZest and bring to a boil. Gradually add kale a few handfuls at a time, stirring to let it wilt down. Add baked tofu, cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 15 minutes or until kale is tender. Stir in lime juice and top with sliced scallions. Note: Select tomato products packaged in glass or cartons. These materials do not contain BPA.

ingredientsList.ingredient: firm tofu, drained well, cut into 1 inch cubes
small jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
Dr. Fuhrman's MatoZest (or other no-salt seasoning blend, adjusted to taste)
bunch kale, tough stems and center ribs removed and leaves chopped

author: www.DrFuhrman.com

title: Nutritarian Asian Quinoa Salad
description: This recipe is AMAZING with Hello Nutritarian's Carrot Ginger Dressing.
instructions: Mix ingredients. Toss with your favorite dressing. Optional Edamame.

ingredientsList.ingredient: shredded Purple cabbage and/or green cabbage

author: Elisha, CNC

title: Eat to Live Mexican Salad
description: You're going to love this easy-to-meal-prep high-protein vegan Mexican Salad recipe!  This traditional favorite gets a healthy oil-free and low-sodium makeover!
instructions:
Press the Tofu: Press tofu for at least 10 minutes while you prepare the lettuce.  You can use a tofu press or layer napkins on the top and bottom of the drained tofu block and use a cutting board topped with books as a weight. 

Prepare Fresh Veggies: Wash and dry the head of iceberg lettuce.  Allow to fully fry before cutting into bite-sized pieces. Dice the bell pepper and avocado, and set aside.  If you're making the homemade No-Added-Salt Pico de Gallo you can make that recipe now. 

Cook the Tofu: Cut the pressed tofu block into bite-sized squares. In a large pan or dutch oven add veggie broth over medium-high heat.  

Place the tofu cubes into the pan and allow them to cook for at least 10 minutes without mixing on the first side. Then flip the cubes to the next side. Cook for another 5 to 7 minutes and then flip to the next side. Once your veggie broth is fully absorbed reduce the temperature to tow heat. Add 1/8 cup of the homemade Nutritarian Hot Sauce recipe or you can substitute 1/4 tsp. taco seasoning mixed with 1/4 cup tomato paste.  Combine well and remove from heat. 

Assemble the Salad: Divide the head of iceberg lettuce between two large plates.  Add 1/2 cup heated Oil-Free Refried Beans (or sub with fat-free store bought brand)to each salad. Divide the tofu 'taco' meat in half and layer on top of the refried beans on each salad. Garnish each salad with 1/2 cup pico de gallo, 1/4 cup diced red bell pepper and 1/4 cup diced avocado. 

RECIPE NOTES: Makes 2 servings.
comment: NOTES FOR PREPPING AHEAD: Make sure to separate the hot components (tofu, beans and hot sauce) from the cold components in different glass containers.  Don't prep ahead the avocado more than 1 day--use lime juice to reduce oxidation.  The tofu 'taco' meat will last up to 9 days in the fridge in a glass storage container.
author: Kristen Hong

title: Nutritarian Stir Fry Sauce
description: Vegan. Nutritarian. Gluten Free. Here are two great recipes to pair with the stir fry sauce: Nutritarian Chinese Lettuce Wraps Peanut Sauce.
instructions: Pour 1/2 cup water over dates in a microwave safe bowl. (remove pits from dates). Microwave on high for 1 minute into a blender cup, pour date/water mixture and remaining ingredients and blend on high until smooth. Pour mixture into a mason jar and store in the fridge. Use in stir fry recipes, or Chinese Lettuce Wraps. DELISH.
author: Elisha,CNC

title: Black Bean Quinoa Soup
description: In less than 40 minutes, you can enjoy this delicious black bean soup. It's flavored with chili powder, cilantro and lime juice and topped with chopped avocado for a Mexican flare.
instructions: In a soup pot, heat 2-3 tablespoons water, add onion and green pepper and water saute until tender, about 5 minutes, adding more water if needed to prevent sticking. Add garlic and saute another 30 seconds, until fragrant. Add the tomatoes, cumin, chili powder and red pepper flakes and cook for 2-3 minutes, until tomatoes soften. Add carrots and vegetable broth, bring to a boil, stir in the quinoa, reduce heat, cover and cook for 10 minutes. Add black beans and continue cooking until heated through and quinoa is tender, about 10 minutes. Add spinach or kale and stir until wilted. Remove from heat and stir in cilantro and lime juice. Serve garnished with chopped avocado.

ingredientsList.ingredient: low sodium or no-salt-added vegetable broth
cooked black beans or 2 (15 ounce) cans low sodium or no-salt-added black beans, drained

author: www.drfuhrman.com

title: Channa Saag (Spicy Chickpeas with Spinach)
description: Channa Saag is a popular Indian dish featuring chickpeas and spinach in a spicy sauce. This version is so quick and easy, you can have it on the table in 20 minutes.
instructions: Water saute onion and garlic until tender. Add the tomatoes, green chilies, tamarind, cumin, coriander, and spinach. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the chickpeas and cayenne pepper and cook for another 5 minutes. If using dried tamarind pods, remove the fruit from the pods, boil for 10 minutes or until soft. Drain and mash with a fork.

ingredientsList.ingredient: tamarind powder or paste (salt free) or dried tamarind pods, optional
cooked chickpeas or 1 (15 ounce) can no-salt-added or low-sodium chickpeas, drained

author: Thad Roe
